h3.style: font-size: 24px; background: rgb(184, 11, 11); color: rgb(255, 255, 255); padding: 10px; margin: 20px 0px;

span.span:
April 7, 2020
Dear PSD Parents and Patrons,
Yesterday, Governor Inslee issued an executive order to close all K-12 public and private schools for the remainder of the school year. As part of our service to the community of Prosser, we will continue to offer distance learning, child nutrition programs, and childcare options to first responders and medical workers. If you have questions or comments, please feel free to contact us at 509-786-2881 or email us at PSDHelpline@prosserschools.org
K-8 Distance Learning Information
Prosser School District is committed to offering distance learning in two formats in order to accommodate our students and families. We will continue to offer online classes to those families who have access to the internet. On Monday, April 13, Prosser School District will be checking out devices to those families that responded with a need for a device and have access to the internet. For families with K-8 students, needing paper homework packets, they may pick up their students’ assignments every Monday from 11:00 a.m. – 12:30 p.m. at Keene-Riverview and Whitstran Elementary Schools.
PHS Distance Learning Information
On Monday, April 13, Prosser School District will be issuing computers to students who are in need of technology in order to complete their assignments and have access to the internet. If you have not already requested a device, please contact PSDHelpline@prosserschools.org before Thursday for more information. We will also be offering students the opportunity to retrieve printed material Wednesday, April 15, at Prosser High School. If the printed material has not been specifically requested, we can’t guarantee it will be ready for pick-up. If you have not made a request for printed material through your teacher or through email, please email Mr. Funk at david.funk@prosserschools.org to make a request. Please be understanding as we work through this difficult challenge to identify the needs of our students.
Although our learning options look different now, we will strive to ensure that we support all students towards the goal of graduation. In complying with statewide social-distancing mandates and stay-at-home orders, we have not yet decided how we will celebrate commencement for the class of 2020. Please know that we will be working through this and it is our hope to celebrate this accomplishment in an appropriate way, once the situation improves for all who might be involved in this celebration. Please look for more information to come.
Thank you,
Matthew Ellis
Superintendent
Waiver to Allow Parent/Guardian Meal Pickup

USDA has issued a nationwide waiver to allow parents and guardians to pick up meals without children being present. Under this waiver, Program operators with an approved waiver allowing non-congregate meal distribution during COVID-19-related operations may distribute meals to a parent or guardian to take home to their children.

br.br:
Due to the amount of communications that will go out over the coming days we have a webpage dedicated to the COVID-19. Please click HERE for the page or on the "read more" link under the Coronavirus icon in the middle of this page.
Attention!
PROSSER SCHOOL DISTRICTMEALS PROGRAM INFORMATION
During school closures, FREE Grab and Go meals will be available to ALL children 0-18 years from 11:00AM - 12:30PM
At the following locations:
KEENE-RIVERVIEW ELEMENTARY SCHOOL
832 PARK AVE.
(bus loading zone-drive thru style, walk ups welcome)
HOUSEL MIDDLE SCHOOL
2001 HIGHLAND DR
(meals will be located in the parking lot near the north gym)
WHITSTRAN ELEMENTARY SCHOOL
10201 W FOISY RD
(bus loading zone-drive thru style, walk ups welcome)
Meals MUST be taken and consumed OFF SITE. Each child will receive two meals, lunch for the day and breakfast for the following morning.
If you have any questions call PSD Child Nutrition at (509) 786-2848 or the District Office at (509) 786-3323.
Pay increase for Substitute Teachers
Starting March 1st, 2020 the rate of pay for substitute teachers will be raised $10 per day. Taking the pay from $125 per day to $135 per day. If you are interested in applying to be a substitute teacher please contact Kim Bolt at 509-786-3323.
Important Construction Message:

div.span: "Students - Construction of the site for the new high school has begun, fences surround the site, AND THIS AREA IS OFF LIMITS TO STUDENTS AND ADULTS. For your safety, please do not enter inside any of the fencing at any time of day. All foot traffic should occur on the sidewalks available along Paterson, Alexander, and Highland. The parking lot to the Softball and Soccer fields, along with some parking at the stadium, remain available for those after school activities at this time. Please be respectful of the work, boundaries, and efforts. Thank You!"

Meeting ID: 272 951 205

h3.style: background: rgb(184, 11, 11); color: rgb(255, 255, 255); padding: 10px; margin: 20px 0px;
h3.span: Educational Lessons for the Week of 4/13:

span.br:
For those families with K-8 students, needing paper homework packets, they may pick up their students’ assignments every Monday from 11:00 a.m. – 12:30 p.m. at Keene-Riverview and Whitstran Elementary School.
PHS Printed Material Packet Information
Students in grades 9-12, without internet access and who have requested print materials will be able to pick those up on Wednesday, April 15, at Prosser High School. More information will come with a specific time and process. If a device is checked out on Monday, April 13, the work will be available online and those students will be removed from the printed material pick up list. If the print material has not been specifically requested there is not a guarantee that it will be ready for pick up. If you have not made a request for print material through your teacher or through email, please email Mr. Funk at david.funk@prosserschools.org to make a request.
Please be understanding as we work through this difficult challenge to identify the needs of our students.

div.p: Prosser School District does not discriminate in any programs or activities on the basis of sex, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, age, veteran or military status, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, disability, or the use of a trained dog guide or service animal and provides equal access to the Boys Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following employee has been designated to handle questions and complaints of alleged discrimination:

ul.li: Civil Rights Coordinator for State Law
